bibl.title: The Asklepiades and Athenodoros Archives: A Case Study of a Linguistic Approach to Papyrus Letters.
bibl.note: The formulaic language of the letters: 1. The health wish with a comparative subclause (The Asklepiades archive and Isidora's writing style; - The Athenodoros archive; - The phraseology of the comparative subclause in the health wish); - 2. Health wish with a relative clause (The relative subclause in the initial health wish: a Latin borrowing?); - 3. Lexical variation in the archives (The intensifier διὰ παντός; - The word string θεὸς καὶ κύριος). - Onomastics. - Conclusion: The linguistic approach establishes convincingly the relationship between the Asklepiades and Athenodoros archives. - Avec résumé en anglais.
